titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Oversize Ms. Codex 1257: Ars epistolandi ... etc.

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of various letters and documents, including much poetry. The poetry treats topics such as language, games and taverns, religion, and love. Also contains treatises on Latin grammar and punctuation. Includes some extracts on morality and proverbs from a variety of classical and Christian authors, including Seneca, Cicero, Augustine, and Pope Innocent I (f. 22v-27v). Many of the documents are notarized by Antonius de Vecelli (example, f. 16r). Many of the leaves are heavily damaged due to dampness.

msItem.title: Regula sive modus tenendus in examinatione testium, f. 8r
De punctis fiendis quin scribitur, f. 16v
Primum in notificando nuptias videlicet de publichatu, f. 28r
Tractatus de diversis significationibus verborum, f. 37r
De verbis et versus in quibus continentur omnia deponentia, f. 53r
Lectura super summam grammaticalem data per Antonium filium Ser Verceli, f. 71r

supportDesc.extent: 89 leaves : 230 x 210 mm. bound to 310 x 220 mm
supportDesc.foliation: Paper, 89 pages; [1-89]; modern foliation in pencil, upper right recto.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in a variety of cursive scripts.

decoDesc.decoNote: Decorated initials, some colored in red, blue and yellow (example, f. 9r, f. 12r). Several manicules.

origin.p: Written in Pieve di Cadore, Italy (Zacour-Hirsch) from 1414 (f. 70v) to 1497 (f. 89v).

history.provenance: Appears in Bernard M. Rosenthal's catalogue 18 (1966), no. 6.
Gift of Philip J. Nordell, 1966 (inside lower cover).

keywords.term: Latin poetry, Medieval and modern--Early works to 1800
